document_data.name: Great Drunkard
document_data.mainbody: The '''Great Drunkard''' was one of the colossal [[Walking Statues of Waterdeep]] located in the [[Castle Ward of Waterdeep|Castle Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]], south of The Market.
document_data.History:
During the [[Spellplague]] of [[1385 DR]], the walking statue appeared and rampaged through the city. When stopped, the statue tumbled backwards onto a building.

[[Gralkyn's Tavern]] sat in the statue's lap by [[1492 DR]].{{Waterdeep-time}}
document_data.Description: The pose resembled that of a drunkard who had fallen asleep, its arms limp to the sides and its head tilted on its chest. The statue originally carried a large stone battleaxe, which was located nearby in the cobbles where it fell.
